pattern comes from s a c k s a c k supporting a community with kindness is a 501c3 nonprofit organization s a c k was established in 2017 in an effort to connect people from all over the world to knit and crochet soap sacks and donate them with a bar of soap inside each one to those in need these donations are given to homeless shelters local food pantries veteran clinics mission trips relief efforts lgbtq+ organizations and social service agencies stacy wiener is the founder of s a c k through stacy s volunteer work at food pantries she discovered that there was a lack of essential toiletries available while it is important that people donate food to their local pantries and shelters there is often a lack of soap shampoo toothpaste toothbrushes and other basic essential toiletries being donated so s a ck was created to help fill this need the number of volunteers in the s a c k community has grown exponentially since 2017 with an estimated 130 000+ soap sacks having been distributed globally the response has been overwhelmingly positive since there is a definite need for toiletries throughout the underserved population if you would like to join the s a c k community you can help in the following ways 1 no matter how big or small your contribution donating directly to s a c k helps them to purchase yarn and soap for s a c k volunteers visit the s a c k website for more information https //www soapsacks com/donate/ 2 you can crochet/knit soap sacks with a full size bar of soap in its original packaging placed inside each sack in your local area you can donate your soap sacks to homeless shelters social service agencies food pantries and various other shelters and charities in your area donating a handmade soap sack adds a personal touch to these basic essentials as it shows someone that you care your donation could help to make a positive change in someone s life thank you for reading the inspiration behind this pattern xx © loopy handmade
